verses.roman:
tatrāgatyāravindākṣo
bhagavān viśva-bhāvanaḥ
vīkṣyojjahāra vāmena
taṁ kareṇa sa līlayā

synonyms: tatra—there; āgatya—going; aravinda-akṣaḥ—lotus-eyed; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; viśva—of the universe; bhāvanaḥ—the maintainer; vīkṣya—seeing; ujjahāra—picked up; vāmena—left; tam—it; kareṇa—with His hand; saḥ—He; līlayā—easily.
translation: The lotus-eyed Supreme Lord, maintainer of the universe, went to the well and saw the lizard. Then with His left hand He easily lifted it out.
